page.title: 09 BERRINGTON HALL
page.content: {Berrington Hall}was modernised over a hundred years ago by the{Rodney family.{Admiral Rodney}served in the Napoleonic War. The land used to be owned by the family but now it is rented out by{The National Trust. There is an interesting{nursery}in the Hall. The room is full of children's toys including a beautiful rocking-horse and doll's house. There is a display of children's clothes. {The Ladies Boudoir}is a small room with a window seat. The ladies side of the doors are beautifully carved and there is a decorated ceiling. Doen in the{laundry}they have a good display of early washing equipment, irons, mangles etc. The{dining room}has a series of paintings, around the room, showing battles at sea. This room overlooks the{lake.
